> Find the impulse response at v_2(t) in Figure P11–17. Find the circuit’s step response.

### Transfer function

Da det er en spændingsdeler gør flg. sig gældende - _efter en laplacetransformation_:

$$V_2(s) = V_1(s)\;\cdot\; \frac{R_2+\frac{1}{Cs}}{R_1+R_2+\frac{1}{Cs}}$$

Omskrevet[^1]:
$$\underset{Y(s)}{\underbrace{V_2(s)}} = \underset{X(s)}{\underbrace{V_1(s)}}\;\cdot\; \underset{T_V(s) \; \lor \; H(s)}{\underbrace{\frac{R_2Cs+1}{R_1Cs+R_2Cs+1}}}
$$

### Transfer function

$$
T_V(s)=\frac{R_2Cs+1}{R_1Cs+R_2Cs+1}
$$

KomponentID:

$$
R_1 = 33k\Omega\\
R_2 = 47k\Omega\\
C = 0.15 \mu F
$$

$$
T_V(s)=\frac{47k\Omega \cdot 0.15 \mu F \cdot s+1}{33k\Omega \cdot0.15 \mu F s+47k\Omega \cdot 0.15 \mu F s+1} =
\frac{0.5875\cdot(s+141.8)}{s+83.33}
$$
Her ses det at et enkelt nulpunkt er at finde $z_1 = -141.8 \; rad/s$ og en enkelt pol $p_1 = -83.33 \; rad/s$

```{r, echo = FALSE}

x_zero <- c(-141-8)
y_zero <- c(0)
x_pole <- c(-83.33)
y_pole <- c(0)
pole_zero_plot(x_zero, y_zero, x_pole, y_pole,150)
```

### Impulserespons

Ved at gøre følgende:
$$
v_{impulse}(t)=
\mathcal{L}^{-1}\left\{
T_V(s)
\right\}
=
\mathcal{L}^{-1}\left\{
\frac{0.5875\cdot(s+141.8)}{s+83.33}
\right\}
$$
Dette giver:
$$
\boxed{
v_{impulse}(t) =
0.5785 \cdot \left(\delta(t)+58.47e^{-83.33t}\right)\cdot u(t)
}$$

### Steprespons

Ved at gøre følgende:

$$
v_{step}(t)=\mathcal{L}^{-1}\left\{
\frac{1}{s} \cdot H(s)
\right\}
=
\mathcal{L}^{-1}\left\{
\frac{1}{s} \cdot T_V(s)
\right\}
=
\mathcal{L}^{-1}\left\{
\frac{0.5875\cdot(s+141.8)}{s^2+83.33s}
\right\}
$$

Dette giver:

$$
\boxed{
v_{step}(t) = (0.5875\cdot(1.702-0.702e^{-83.33t}))\cdot u(t)
}
$$

### Driving point impedans

Vi har følgende KVL loop:

$$
v_1(t)=v_r+v_r+v_c
$$
Dette laplace transformeres:

$$
\mathcal{L}^{-1}\left\{
v_1(t)
\right\}
=
\mathcal{L}^{-1}\left\{
v_{R1}(t)
\right\} +
\mathcal{L}^{-1}\left\{
v_{R2}(t)
\right\} +
\mathcal{L}^{-1}\left\{
v_C(t)
\right\}
$$

og giver:
$$
V_1(s) = V_{R1}(s)+V_{R2}(s)+V_C(s)
$$

En let omskrivning

$$
V_1(s)= I(s)(R_1+R_2)+ \frac{1}{Cs} I(s)
$$

Dermed:

$$
\frac{V_1(s)}{I(s)} = R_1+R_2 + \frac{1}{Cs}
$$

og vi har driving point impedansen:

$$
Z(s) = \frac{CR_1s+CR_2s+1}{Cs}
$$

og vi har driving point impedansen / med værdier!:
$$
\boxed{
Z(s) = \frac{80000\cdot(s+83.33)}{s}
}
$$


[^1]: Er $T_V(s) = H(s)$ ?
